intro: Correa aemula, commonly known as the pink correa, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to red tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has slender, evergreen foliage with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and aromatic. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Correa aemula is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
